member.name: T:SUnit.Discovery.Finder
member.summary: Contains methods for finding tests.

member.name: M:SUnit.Discovery.Finder.IsValidTestMethod(System.Reflection.MethodInfo)
member.summary: Indicates whether the specified is a valid test method.
member.returns: True if the specified is valid.

member.name: M:SUnit.Discovery.Finder.FindAllValidTestMethods(System.Type)
member.summary: Finds all the methods on the specified type that are valid test methods.
member.returns: All methods defined on the type that are valid test methods.

member.name: M:SUnit.Discovery.Finder.GetDefaultConstructor(System.Type)
member.summary: Gets the eligible default constructor for the specified type, if one exists.
member.returns: The eligible default constructor, if one exists. if none is found.

member.name: M:SUnit.Discovery.Finder.FindNamedConstructors(System.Type)
member.summary: Finds all the valid named constructors on the specified type.
member.returns: All the valid named constructor methods on the specified fixture type.

member.name: M:SUnit.Discovery.Finder.FindNamedConstructorsOnNonGenericType(System.Type)
member.summary: Finds all the valid named constructors on a non generic, or constructed generic, fixture type.
member.param: The type of the fixture. Must be either non-generic or a fully-constructed generic type. In other words, must be .
member.returns: All valid named constructor methods found on the fixture type.

member.name: M:SUnit.Discovery.Finder.FindNamedConstructorsOnGenericType(System.Type)
member.summary: Finds all the valid named constructors on an unconstructed generic fixture type. On an unconstructed generic fixture type, a valid named constructor returns a constructed version of the fixture, or a subclass of a constructed version of the fixture.
member.param: The type of the fixture. Must be a not-fully-constructed generic type. In other words, must be .
member.returns: All valid named constructor methods found on the fixture type.
